revised_title: Coal to Liquid Fuels: The Mobil Methanol-to-Gasoline Process
tldr: This article discusses a new route to produce liquid fuels from coal using the Mobil Methanol-to-Gasoline (MTG) process. The process involves converting coal to methanol, which is then converted to high-quality gasoline using a zeolite catalyst. The MTG process offers a more cost-effective and environmentally friendly alternative to existing coal liquefaction methods, such as the Fischer-Tropsch process. The article also highlights the chemistry behind the MTG process and the potential for future development and expansion of this technology.
